intro: Navarretia erecta, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright, grass-like stems and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Navarretia erecta is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is known for its ability to survive in cold, high-altitude environments. Its life cycle is closely tied to seasonal snowmelt, making it a symbol of the Sierra Nevada ecosystem.
